Class UniformDistributionPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.view.DistributionParameterPanel
                      de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.view.UniformDistributionPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class UniformDistributionPanel
extends DistributionParameterPanel

This class represents the parameters of an Uniform probability distribution. An Uniform probability distribution has two parameters, a and b. Those form a so-called range, where a is the minimum and b is the maximum of the range or interval.

In an Uniform probability function all values have the same probability. In other words, they're all equal likely. For more informations about this distribution, have a look at UniformDistribution.

Parameters
a = minimum
b = maximum

Since:
May/06/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

UniformDistributionPanel

public UniformDistributionPanel(ProbabilityDistribution distribution)
constructor is passed the probability distribution to which it belongs. This is because, we have to pass on the typed in values.

UniformDistributionPanel

public UniformDistributionPanel(ProbabilityDistribution distribution,
                                DistributionPanel panel)
constructor is passed the probability distribution and the parent panel. Remember, this is a panel for a specific probability distribution and is itself only a sub-panel.

Distribution
This is the probability distribution of this panel. The panel is responsible for updating typed in values and changes to that distribution. Because there're many different distributions available, one for all can't be realized. So there is one parameter panel for one distribution.

Distribution panel
This is the parent panel and holds all available probability distributions. When a particular distribution is selected by the tester, it gets the corresponding parameter panel. The parameter panel (this) is only responsible for the parameter settings like a and/or b. When an update occrus down here, it has to call its parent which in turn calls its parent, too. In other words, the chain of responsibility is followed.

Parameters:
distribution - that's the distribution the panel is responsible for.
panel - the parent panel gets notified whenever an update occurs down here.
Method Detail

changeSpinnerModel_A

protected void changeSpinnerModel_A(int currentValue,
                                    int N,
                                    int step)
initializes the spinner model with the current value to display, the min and max values and the stepping. This is necessary when a change in the fill behaviour happens.

Parameters:
currentValue - the initial value to display
N - the total amount of values. Because this is in terms of a probability distribution, we refer to it as X.
step - the stepping between min & max

changesSpinnerModel_B

protected void changesSpinnerModel_B(int currentValue,
                                     int N,
                                     int step)
initializes the spinner model for parameter b with the inital value, the min and max value and the stepping. This is necessary, when a change in the fill behaviour happens.

Parameters:
currentValue - the initial value to display
N - the total amount of values. Because this is in terms of a probability distribution, we refer to it as X.
step - the stepping between min & max

resetInputFields

protected void resetInputFields()
Description copied from class: DistributionParameterPanel
gives the opportunity to reset the fields used as input. Subclasses must do this by its own, because its base class (this) doesn't know which ones are actually used.

Specified by:
resetInputFields in class DistributionParameterPanel

setValues

protected void setValues(double[] values)
sets the min and max values into text fields.

values[0] = a
values[1] = b

Specified by:
setValues in class DistributionParameterPanel
Parameters:
values - the length of the array and what values are passed can not specified here.
